name: Marinated Vegetarian Pasta Salad
description: Recipe video above! How do you make the best ever vegetable pasta salad? MARINATE the veggies. Roast or BBQ any veg you want, then toss in a marinade so they absorb the flavour while hot before mixing through pasta. This is a big, fat JUICY flavour loaded pasta salad that lasts for days and days - see PRO TIP for keeping pasta salads juicy!
recipeIngredient: 400g / 14oz  curly pasta (, dried (or other of choice))
2  capsicum/bell peppers ((1 red, 1 yellow), cut into 2.5cm / 1" pieces)
1  eggplant (, halved lengthwise, then 1.25cm/ 0.5" thick semi circles)
1  bunch asparagus (, ends trimmed, cut into 5cm/2" lengths)
1/2 tsp each dried basil, parsley, oregano, thyme ((Note 2))
1/2 - 1 tsp chilli flakes ((adjust spice to taste, Note 3))

itemListElement.text: Place ingredients in a jar and shake well. Set aside 10 minutes+.
itemListElement.name: Place ingredients in a jar and shake well. Set aside 10 minutes+.

itemListElement.text: Preheat oven to 250°C/480°F (230°F fan) - super high heat replicates BBQ charred edges.
itemListElement.name: Preheat oven to 250°C/480°F (230°F fan) - super high heat replicates BBQ charred edges.

itemListElement.text: Toss veggies in oil - Place all vegetables other than asparagus in a large bowl. Drizzle with oil, sprinkle with salt, pepper and garlic, toss.
itemListElement.name: Toss veggies in oil - Place all vegetables other than asparagus in a large bowl. Drizzle with oil, sprinkle with salt, pepper and garlic, toss.

itemListElement.text: Spread vegetables on 2 trays (fill one less than the other). Roast 25 minutes, tossing once.
itemListElement.name: Spread vegetables on 2 trays (fill one less than the other). Roast 25 minutes, tossing once.

itemListElement.text: Add asparagus - Drizzle asparagus with oil and pinch of salt and pepper. Add into oven for last 5 minutes.
itemListElement.name: Add asparagus - Drizzle asparagus with oil and pinch of salt and pepper. Add into oven for last 5 minutes.

itemListElement.text: BBQ Option: See Marinated BBQ Vegetables for directions.
itemListElement.name: BBQ Option: See Marinated BBQ Vegetables for directions.

itemListElement.text: Marinate veggies - Transfer vegetables into large bowl, pour over 1/2 the Dressing. Toss, then leave to marinate for 30 minutes to 3 hours.
itemListElement.name: Marinate veggies - Transfer vegetables into large bowl, pour over 1/2 the Dressing. Toss, then leave to marinate for 30 minutes to 3 hours.

itemListElement.text: Cook pasta + 2 minutes: In large pot of salted water, cook pasta per packet directions but ADD 2 minutes to the cook time (Note 5 for why). Drain and return pasta into pot.
itemListElement.name: Cook pasta + 2 minutes: In large pot of salted water, cook pasta per packet directions but ADD 2 minutes to the cook time (Note 5 for why). Drain and return pasta into pot.

itemListElement.text: Add vegetables, including veg juices, into the pasta pot. Add remaining Dressing and parsley, then toss. Set aside for 15 minutes to cool slightly.
itemListElement.name: Add vegetables, including veg juices, into the pasta pot. Add remaining Dressing and parsley, then toss. Set aside for 15 minutes to cool slightly.

itemListElement.text: Serve! Sprinkle with feta and serve! Keeps 4 - 5 days, serve at room temp.
itemListElement.name: Serve! Sprinkle with feta and serve! Keeps 4 - 5 days, serve at room temp.

itemListElement.text: SCOOP OUT a mug of pasta cooking water just before draining. Add 3 tbsp water to reserved Dressing (after marinating veg), shake well. Use this Dressing per above, but reserve 3 tbsp to freshen up pasta salad on Day 2 onwards.
itemListElement.name: SCOOP OUT a mug of pasta cooking water just before draining. Add 3 tbsp water to reserved Dressing (after marinating veg), shake well. Use this Dressing per above, but reserve 3 tbsp to freshen up pasta salad on Day 2 onwards.

itemListElement.text: Freshen up pasta salad: Bring to room temp or briefly microwave (cold pasta = dry) to warm gently. Toss with Reserved Dressing then serve.
itemListElement.name: Freshen up pasta salad: Bring to room temp or briefly microwave (cold pasta = dry) to warm gently. Toss with Reserved Dressing then serve.

review.reviewBody: This is easy and delicious awesome - but took about 30+mins to prepare the veges. We will be making this again and again!

Absolutely fantastic pasta salad. Have made it several times (for myself, for a crowd, etc) and it’s always a winner! Definitely better in the summertime when all the veg is at its peak but it’s so easy to tweak this based on what’s in season. I’ve added a can of white beans in the past to bulk it up a bit for work lunches. All around such a stellar recipe!

This was SO GOOD, full of flavour. Excellent tips on keeping the salad from drying out and such an easy meal to prep. I made it with protein pasta, absolute winner. Will be eating on repeat over summer- such a tasty way of getting in serves of veggies!

This was amazing. Made using up leftover veggies in my fridge (cauliflower, mushroom, zucchini, onion and yellow beans) and used cheese tortellini for the pasta. The flavour of the dressing with the roasted vegetables and pasta was so tasty. The leftovers tasted great too for the next two days lunches. Highly recommend.
This pasta salad was a hit! People couldn’t stop raving about it
This is so good! I made it once and everyone at home couldn't get enough of it. I added some grilled chicken to it. Definitely making this at least once a week for lunch/dinner. Thanks Nagi!

It doesn’t matter how many times I make this, it always feels like my tastebuds hit the rollercoaster of emotions,  Pure joyful flavours explode in my mouth and happiness totally envelops me.  I can hear my family chuckle “Sounds like Mums made her marinated veggie pasta salad again”
Thank you Nagi, another winning recipe.  Any chance you can add this recipe in your next cook book please x
Love this recipe. This is made many time in our home.  Love the dressing.  Thank you.

I've wanted to make this forever and finally did tonight! It didn't disappoint. I didn't have zucchini, mushrooms or asparagus and added in broccoli, artichokes and kalamata olives. Seriously the best pasta salad I've ever made!!!!
Fantastic salad - made it for Christmas and again today so I can take it to work next week for lunch!  Another winner!!!
Tasty and impressive, a good dish for pot luck dinners with friends
I have made this salad a handful of times already, it is absolutely delicious. This is a new favourite in our household! Thank you Nagi!

keywords: Grilled vegetable marinade, Grilled vegetables, vegetable pasta salad
